Wisconsin, Trump, Fields, Lewandowski, Violence. Salena Zito, Pittsburgh Tribune-Review. Lara Brown, George Washington University.

â€œâ€¦Itâ€™s important, in the wake of this fracas, to remember that initially all Fields wanted was an apology. Instead her integrity, and the veracity of the Washington Postâ€™s account, were called into question. So she filed a police report because, in the face of unabashed lying by the Trump campaign, it was the only way to â€œproveâ€ her story true.

â€œNow that thereâ€™s a legal paper trail, in what borders on the absurd, Donald Trump continues to support Lewandowski. â€œLook at tapes-nothing there!â€ he tweeted after the news broke, with a link to a recording that shows his campaign manager grabbing Fields clear as day.

â€œA few hours later Trump even went on offense, tweeting a photo of Fields holding a pen close to his jacket. â€œWhy is this reporter touching me as I leave news conference? What is in her hand??â€ In another he asked, â€œWhy is she allowed to grab me and shout questions? Can I press charges?â€ In an interview this evening, he asked why she didnâ€™t scream if she was bruised by the altercation, as she tweeted.

â€œPerhaps the most befuddling thing politically is that Trump continues to defend this guy. Other political candidates would distance themselves from such actions. Theyâ€™d say their campaign doesnâ€™t condone violence. Any other political candidate, after an apology and investigation, would fire Lewandowski (and the calls to fire Lewandowski are growing louder every day).
